16635295-d095-4c3b-8804-a64731c3cdbe.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated competency in exploring and applying essential elements of early childhood education and environmental education combined in a culturally responsive urban nature-based setting. Earners are able to create, conduct and evaluate indoor and outdoor urban nature-based programs for young children, emphasizing inclusive hands-on nature-based curriculum and experiential goals in densely-populated, diverse urban spaces and those with limited access to nature.
16635295-d095-4c3b-8804-a64731c3cdbe.name: ECOPEEP

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of coursework and outdoor assignments through Alverno College’s Urban Nature-Based Early Childhood Education course.

8b732f5a-34fc-42b9-9315-9079ed84ba60.description: Earners of this badge have developed the knowledge base and skills to positively affect character development and social-emotional learning in their school communities. They understand the principles of Character Education, and have deepened their understanding of the foundations of character ed, student and staff empowerment, compassion and resilience, self-care and motivation, connecting character to academics, diversity education, and building relationships and a caring community.
8b732f5a-34fc-42b9-9315-9079ed84ba60.name: LACCS Program Participant

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 6 of the 8 live LACCS Sessions during the 2022-2023 program year.
Actively engage as a member of their school team in the development of a strategic action plan for their organizations character initiatives.

15148e94-88eb-44c7-ab09-3affe2f65ce3.description: People who complete this badge will have experience in using all the basic structures of the Python language in a variety of contexts. They will also have practice selecting the appropriate tools for solving various problems, with attention to the benefits and drawbacks of the tools. Finally, they will have experience using resources to improve their Python skills independently.
15148e94-88eb-44c7-ab09-3affe2f65ce3.name: Python Programmer

badge_template_activities.title: Learners completing MT 268 Python Programming will: 1. Work independently and collaboratively to successfully solve problems. 2. Accurately define problems and identify methods to solve them.  3. Appropriately use Python to implement solutions.  4. Appropriately use basic programming structures such as variables, conditional statements, loops, functions, classes, objects, dictionaries, etc. 5. Read, write, and communicate programming concepts effectively using proper vocabulary and syntax.

b962af7b-bda5-45e4-9fa1-7d2dc5d2539f.description: Earners of this badge have learned how different functional teams impact each other across an organization. Earners are able to: identify and break down silos among teams using process improvement, build long-term constructive working relationships across teams, align goals and strengthen team cohesion and develop effective communication strategies to achieve transparency.
b962af7b-bda5-45e4-9fa1-7d2dc5d2539f.name: Breaking Silos and Building Teams to Achieve Goal Alignment

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed a 4-week unit of instruction through Alverno College and have demonstrated understanding of effectively developing and leading operations.

aaa0a3cf-c232-4db8-829b-3285b40e1e24.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated understanding of effectively developing and leading operations. Earners are able to understand different leadership styles and how to lead from any position, self-awareness and emotional intelligence, and how to foster growth mindset to achieve operational success.
aaa0a3cf-c232-4db8-829b-3285b40e1e24.name: Building a Learning Culture

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed a 4-week unit of instruction through Alverno College and have demonstrated understanding of effectively developing and leading operations. Earners are able to understand different leadership styles and how to lead from any position, self-awareness and emotional intelligence, and how to foster a growth mindset to achieve operational success.

f96d9107-b279-4c78-9451-95c490531695.description: Earners of this badge are practiced in using an ethical decision making model, referencing a professional Code of Ethics, and seeking supervision when faced with a dilemma. A broad range of ethical encounters was explored with feedback as learning. While all music therapists are required to update their ethical understanding every 5 years, earners of this badge have engaged with the premier disciplinary leader on this topic, Dr. Cheryl Dileo, for 15 clock hours of study, discussion, and practice
f96d9107-b279-4c78-9451-95c490531695.name: Music Therapy - Issues in Ethics

badge_template_activities.title: The earner successfully completed 18 CMTE (continuing music therapy education) credits at Alverno College through the two-day workshop, “Contemporary Issues in Ethics,” taught by Dr. Cheryl Dileo, author of the only text solely focused on ethical thinking specific to the music therapy profession. Earners of this badge were challenged to consider and apply the model to examples from their own practice for consideration and feedback prior to successful completion of the course.

b6f508bb-ebb0-4a77-8b7d-13a1a430d5a2.description: Successful completion of 5 graduate credits at Alverno College through MMT 630, Counseling Skills for Music Therapists or MMT 610 Advanced Music Therapy Theory, as well as MMT 632 Advanced Clinical Practice in Music Therapy. Learning outcomes reflect scholarship and assessed skill in these selected @AMTAInc Advanced Competencies.
b6f508bb-ebb0-4a77-8b7d-13a1a430d5a2.name: Advanced Music Therapy Clinical Practice

alignments.name: American Music Therapy Association Advanced Competencies
alignments.description: The American Music Therapy Association has established competency-based standards for ensuring the quality of education and clinical training in the field of music therapy.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of graduate credits at Alverno College through MMT 630, Counseling Skills for Music Therapists.
Successful completion of graduate credits at Alverno College through MMT 610 Advanced Music Therapy Theory.
Successful completion of graduate credits at Alverno College through MMT 632 Advanced Clinical Practice in Music Therapy.

4da9542e-be0d-4484-90a6-bb79af75f9f1.description: Professional music therapists will deepen skills and knowledge in clinical practice by passing two graduate level courses with related content in the area of specialization. Advanced practice badges require theoretical knowledge, research in best practices, process development, skilled application, and reflective practices while receiving expert supervision.
4da9542e-be0d-4484-90a6-bb79af75f9f1.name: Music and Neuroscience

alignments.name: American Music Therapy Association Advanced Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of MMT 614 Music and Neuroscience (3 credits)
Successful completion of MMT 670F Applied Neuroscience (1 credit)
Read and compare neuroscience findings from varied disciplines to interpret in relation to music therapy practice
Differentiate brain measurement techniques to suit brain anatomy and function being addressed
Identify contraindications for music or related activity
Holistic treatment planning related to sensory process utilizing somatosensory, visual, vestibular, and auditory pathways
Engage motor system and pathways with recognition of how components of music influence movement and underlying neurophysiology
Vary musical approach to meet cognitive and developmental goals across the lifespan

skills.name: Applies neuroplasticity principles to music experiences

61076b92-da4c-4723-9024-1d789e1d5b42.description: Professional music therapists will deepen skills and knowledge in leadership by passing two graduate level courses with related content in the area of specialization. Leadership badges require demonstration of theoretical knowledge, research in best practices, cultural humility, reflective practices, and skilled application, both in and out of the online classroom.
61076b92-da4c-4723-9024-1d789e1d5b42.name: Music Therapy Leadership

alignments.name: American Music Therapy Association Advanced Competencies
alignments.description: The American Music Therapy Association has established competency-based standards for ensuring the quality of education and clinical training in the field of music therapy.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of graduate credits at Alverno College through MMT 662, Leadership in Music Therapy.
Successful completion of graduate credits at Alverno College through MMT 660 Advocacy in Music Therapy.

e2ebe474-5cd2-4e90-b5c2-1e12a3ea0034.description: Professional music therapists will deepen skills and knowledge in entrepreneurship by passing two graduate level courses with related content in the area of specialization. Entrepreneurship badges require demonstration of clinical administration skills necessary for business planning and strategic thinking, financial and human resource management, best business practices in areas of marketing and reimbursement, ethical thinking, cultural humility, and reflective practices.
e2ebe474-5cd2-4e90-b5c2-1e12a3ea0034.name: Entrepreneurship in Music Therapy

alignments.name: American Music Therapy Association Advanced Competencies
alignments.description: The American Music Therapy Association has established competency-based standards for ensuring the quality of education and clinical training in the field of music therapy.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of graduate credits at Alverno College through MMT 670, Grant Writing for Music Therapists
Successful completion of graduate credits at Alverno College through MMT 668 Business Development in Music Therapy
Be aware of and adhere to laws and occupational regulations governing the provision of education and health services, particularly with regard to music therapy
Apply the principles of effective leadership
Stay apprised of current issues and trends in music therapy governance, ethics, scope of practice, certification, or licensure
Conceptualize and execute projects that increase positive public perception of music therapy and strengthen professional practice

d17977f4-3d97-4b39-8404-d283e92a5678.description: Earners of this microcredential have demonstrated culturally responsive practice within the context of a Community Music Therapy approach. Service delivery occurred following a two-day workshop and during the Summerfest Music Festival and included professional supervision and feedback. Earners are able to assess and engage individuals of all ages and abilities in single-session community music experiences within the context of a larger musical event.
d17977f4-3d97-4b39-8404-d283e92a5678.name: Community Music Therapy (Adults)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner successfully completed 20 CMTE (continuing music therapy education) credits at Alverno College through the professional development workshop, “Community Music Therapy: In Concert with You.” Focus of clinical practice, professional supervision, and feedback as learning centered on the dynamics of collaborative wellness-focused music experiences during the Summerfest Music Festival.

5f82bb85-26f3-4959-adbb-bfb6b45535d9.description: Earners of this microcredential have demonstrated culturally responsive practice within the context of a Community Music Therapy approach. Service delivery occurred following a two-day workshop and during the Summerfest Music Festival and included professional supervision and feedback. Earners are able to assess and engage individuals of all ages and abilities in single-session community music experiences within the context of a larger musical event.
5f82bb85-26f3-4959-adbb-bfb6b45535d9.name: Community Music Therapy (Children & Families)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner successfully completed 20 CMTE (continuing music therapy education) credits at Alverno College through the professional development workshop, “Community Music Therapy: In Concert with You.” Focus of clinical practice, professional supervision, and feedback as learning centered on the dynamics of clinical music experiences for children and their families provided during the Summerfest Music Festival.

4bc27857-84d1-4253-a21b-b3230c53c9c4.description: Earners of this badge are practiced in using an ethical decision making model, referencing a professional Code of Ethics, and seeking supervision when faced with a dilemma. Participants in the course focused specifically on ethics in relation to professional and private practice in music therapy and the decision making process laid out By Dileo in the 2nd ed. of “Ethical Decision Making in Music Therapy.”
4bc27857-84d1-4253-a21b-b3230c53c9c4.name: Music Therapy - Ethics in Practice

alignments.name: American Music Therapy Association Advanced Competencies
alignments.description: The American Music Therapy Association has established competency-based standards for ensuring the quality of education and clinical training in the field of music therapy.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner successfully completed a 1-credit graduate level course at Alverno College. While all music therapists are required to update their ethical understanding every 5 years, earners of this badge have engaged with a leader in the field on the topic of ethics for a full semester of online study, including lectures, readings, discussions, and assignments to check understanding and application.

9141cc1a-74e8-4813-97fd-9c17ed1c35ac.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated understanding of data mining and how it is used to solve business problems. Earners are able to explore differences between Business Analytics, Data Analytics, and Business Intelligence, and are able to effectively relay a “story” from data by developing different visualization strategies and using various tools.
9141cc1a-74e8-4813-97fd-9c17ed1c35ac.name: Storytelling with Data

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed a 4-week unit of instruction through Alverno College and have demonstrated understanding of data mining and how it is used to solve business problems, have explored differences between Business Analytics, Data Analytics, and Business Intelligence, and are able to effectively relay a “story” from data by developing different visualization strategies and using various tools.

b7112807-a1e5-442f-b5af-76cee5baf935.description: Earners of this badge have learned how data is used to drive decisions in organizations. Earners are able to analyze data to see patterns that are used in decision-making, and can identify and gather specific business data and statistical information. Earners are able to: analyze data used in prescriptive or predictive decision-making, understand data in relation to business planning and operations, and gather data and statistical information to make decisions.
b7112807-a1e5-442f-b5af-76cee5baf935.name: Using Data for Decision-Making

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed a 4-week unit of instruction through Alverno College and have demonstrated understanding of how data is used to drive decisions in organizations.
